summary: This document is a formal request and subpoena from Ghislaine Maxwell's defense attorneys to the U.S. Department of State, seeking passport applications for three minor victims listed in the superseding indictment against Maxwell. The request is made to support Maxwell's defense in her criminal trial, arguing the documents are relevant to establishing travel patterns of the alleged victims.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, charged with multiple counts related to the sexual abuse of minors in conspiracy with Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named as an alleged co-conspirator with Ghislaine Maxwell in a scheme to sexually abuse underaged girls from approximately 1994 to 2004.

persons.name: Christian R. Everdell
persons.context: Attorney from Cohen & Gresser LLP representing Ghislaine Maxwell; author of the request letter and point of contact for the subpoena.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge presiding over the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Ruby J. Krajick
persons.context: Clerk of Court who signed and sealed the subpoena.

connections.description: Alleged to have conspired in a scheme to sexually abuse underaged girls from approximately 1994 to 2004.
Christian R. Everdell is the attorney representing defendant Ghislaine Maxwell in the criminal case.

events.title: Superseding Indictment Filed
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was charged in a superseding indictment with six counts: conspiracy to entice minors, enticement of a minor, conspiracy to transport minors, transportation of a minor, sex trafficking conspiracy, and sex trafficking of a minor.

events.title: Scheduled Trial Date
events.description: The trial in the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell was scheduled to begin at 9:00 A.M. before Judge Alison J. Nathan.

events.title: Alleged Scheme Begins
events.description: The alleged conspiracy between Ghislaine Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein to sexually abuse underaged girls began in or about this year.

events.title: Alleged Scheme Ends
events.description: The alleged conspiracy between Ghislaine Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein to sexually abuse underaged girls continued until in or about this year.

locations: U.S. Department of State, Suit 600 19th Street, NW, Washington, D.C. 20522
United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Courtroom 906, New York, NY 10007
Cohen & Gresser LLP, 800 Third Avenue, 21st Floor, New York, New York 10022
keyFacts: The defense is seeking passport applications from 1994 to the present for three individuals identified as 'Minor Victim 1,' 'Minor Victim 2,' and 'Minor Victim 3' in the superseding indictment.

The defense argues the passport records are directly relevant because the crimes alleged require proof of interstate or foreign travel, and the victims allegedly traveled internationally, sometimes at Epstein's request or with his assistance.
The document reveals the specific charges against Maxwell: six counts including conspiracy, enticement, transportation, and sex trafficking related to minors.
The alleged criminal activity involving Maxwell and Epstein spanned approximately a decade, from 1994 to 2004.
The subpoena is issued under legal authority (Touhy regulations and federal rules) governing requests for documents from federal agencies.
